titleStmt.title: Pappe with an hatchet Alias, a figge for my God sonne. Or cracke me this nut. Or a countrie cuffe, that is, a sound boxe of the eare, for the idiot Martin to hold his peace, seeing the patch will take no warning. VVritten by one that dares call a dog, a dog, and made to preuent Martins dog daies.
titleStmt.author: Lyly, John, 1554?-1606.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A07049 of text S112317 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 17463). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 56 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 20 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Pappe with an hatchet Alias, a figge for my God sonne. Or cracke me this nut. Or a countrie cuffe, that is, a sound boxe of the eare, for the idiot Martin to hold his peace, seeing the patch will take no warning. VVritten by one that dares call a dog, a dog, and made to preuent Martins dog daies.
titleStmt.author: Lyly, John, 1554?-1606.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Iohn Anoke, and Iohn Astile [i.e. T. Orwin], for the Bayliue of Withernam, cum priuilegio perennitatis, and are to bee sold at the signe of the crab tree cudgell in thwack-coate lane,

notesStmt.note: A tract in the Marprelate controversy.
The imprint is false; actual imprint from STC.
In this edition, B2v line 26 has "abusde."; D4v lines 11-12 have "next #5FD\ booke, shall be".
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.
